results.title: A Breath of air
results.brief_description: The film’s main purpose is to help to discourage cigarette smoking by teenagers. It presents to secondary school students a summary of biological and other scientific evidence on the health hazards of smoking. The film contains animated sequences, microphotography, still photos and charts which effectively present its case against smoking cigarettes.

results.title: Breakthrough
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Senior Films and Victorian School for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Education of deaf children in Victoria. At the Princess Elizabeth Kindergarten for the Deaf, very young children start the training which will fit them into a world of sound. Specially trained staff teach small groups by means of lip-reading, drawings and play-acting. Older children attend the St Kilda Road School, where, beside the ordinary curriculum, they learn domestic science, typing or a trade. Commentary by George Fairfax.

results.title: Breaking the habit
results.creator_credit: Henry Jacobs, John Korty, American Cancer Society and Korty Films
results.brief_description: With the theme: “the self-delusion of the cigarette smoker”, records a conversation between two cartoon characters, George, the “quitting” smoker, and his friend. Concludes on a serious but hopeful note, pointing out that the chances of developing serious diseases decrease the moment you stop smoking.

results.title: Breaking the delegation barrier
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Films
results.brief_description: How successful delegation sets free the energy and talents which are the real strength of any undertaking and the importance of overcoming the basic psychological obstacle: fear. At an organisational conference, three men competent and experienced in their own fields, but new to the responsibilities of supervision, are put in charge of newly expanded departments and are faced with a deadline resulting from a rush contract. As the months pass, each experiences and overcomes three of the most prevalent fears of delegation; fear of loss of job satisfaction, of mistakes and their repercussions and fear of loss of authority and prestige.

results.title: Breaking barriers
results.creator_credit: John Sexton Productions, New South Wales. Anti-Discrimination Board and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at your rights under the New South Wales Anti-Discrimination Act, 1977 where “equal opportunity” should be given to all and no discrimination should exist on the grounds of race, sex or marital status.

results.title: Branching out
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the four senior branch sections of the Girl Guide Associations - Air, Land, and Sea Rangers and Cadets, provide modern and lively training with popular appeal for the teenage girl. Training includes gliding, rock climbing, flower arranging, pony trekking, boating, music appreciation, hostessing and welfare work. An International Mixed Camp provides the girls wiht an opportunity of mixing with their contemporaries from other countries.

results.title: Brake free
results.brief_description: This film is designed to encourage imagination and story telling by children. A small boy imagines himself as a railwayman, a train and a driver of the old cog railway that climbs Mt Washington. No narration or dialogue - only sound effects and a musical score.

results.title: Brahms and his music
results.brief_description: Recreates Brahm’s life among scenes closely associated with his development as a composer. These include Vienna, where he reached the height of his career, and the German countryside he loved. Excerpts from the following are included: Sonata No.3 in F for Piano; Symphony No.1; Symphony No.2, and the D Major Violin Concerto.
